publication_before_1920.explanation: Published before 1920 in the US (now in public domain)

publication_1920_1977.explanation: Published 1920-1977 in the US (95 years from publication or life+70, whichever is earlier)

corporate_works.explanation: Corporate authorship in the US (95 years from publication or 120 years from creation, whichever is shorter)

government_works.explanation: US government works are not copyrighted

EU_WARTIME.explanation: Extended copyright term due to WWII (in some EU countries for specific authors)

US.explanation: US government works are not copyrighted

UK.explanation: Crown copyright in UK expires 50 years after publication

CA.explanation: Crown copyright in Canada expires 50 years after publication

AU.explanation: Government works in Australia expire 50 years after publication

IN.explanation: Government works in India expire 60 years after publication

US.explanation: Anonymous works in US: 95 years from publication or 120 years from creation, whichever is shorter

UK.explanation: Anonymous works in UK: 70 years after publication

EU.explanation: Anonymous works in EU: 70 years after publication

US.explanation: Corporate authorship in US: 95 years from publication or 120 years from creation

UK.explanation: Corporate authorship in UK: 70 years after publication

description: Special copyright rules and exceptions by jurisdiction
